fields.description:
Hello Atlassian,

i considered a bug in the Question for Confluence permission handling.

For example:
 * person A is permitted to use Questions
 * person B is NOT permitted to use Questions
 * person A asks a question in the personal space of person B
 * person B is not able to see and answer this question
 * person A gets no information that person B ist not able to see and answer the question
fields.summary: permission bug in Questions for Confluence

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian,

we start using Questions for Confluence in our company. We recognized, What we don't like is that Questions is automatically activated in every space. So if your are alloweed to use Questions, you can use it in a Space, where the other users maybe don't have the permissions for Questions.

My suggestion is, that you build a feature to configure a list of spaces, where Questions can be used. If no space is selected, its activated for all spaces.
fields.summary: Configure Questions Plugin for Confluence for selected spaces

fields.description:
h4. Problem statement
Currently, a page can display content from another page using the "Excerpt Include Macro" or "Page Properties Report Macro". 

However, this content will be *read-only* in the target page where you insert the "Excerpt Include Macro" or "Page Properties Report Macro" to. The change will be reflected in the target page only when the change is done in the source page (containing "Excerpt Macro" and "Page Properties Report Macro".

A user won't be able to update the content from the target page and have the change reflected in the source page.

h4. Suggestion
Allow the content to be dynamically updated across pages. This helps to centralise data across different pages and ensure that all copies of that data are updated when only one copy is updated.
fields.summary: Allow content to be dynamically inserted across multiple pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When loading the Jira Issue/Filter Macro in Confluence pages while using a language that translates the *Epic Link* field name, Epic Links will not be displayed in the filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter in Jira to be added in Confluence that returns issues links to Epic issues.
# Add the *Jira Issue/Filter* macro to a Confluence page.
# Set up the macro to use the filter created in Jira and ensure that *Epic Links* are being displayed in the filter.
# Load the page while having a language such as Japanese set as the main language.
#* This works with either having the user profile in Confluence set to use Japanese or having Japanese being set as the main language in the Browser.

h3. Expected Results
Epic links will show up in the filter macro.

h3. Actual Results
Epic links are not displayed 

h3. Notes
This seems related to [JRASERVER-39009|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39009] - when testing this, Epic Links were shown in different languages only when the translation in the Confluence side did not translate this field name.

h3.Workaround
Ensure that the page is loaded in English.
fields.summary: Epic links don't load in the Jira Issue/Filter macro when the Epic Link field name is translated

fields.description:
Thanks for looking at my suggestion.

I suggest you add a poll or survey capability to Confluence without needing a plug-in.  Polling is a basic, basic component of a collaboration suite – which is the basic premise of using Confluence – and that _should_ be part of the regular package.

Plug-ins are great, but they can shift around and  require IT/management/etc. involvement.

Polls should be there if Confluence wants to claim being a top-tier collaboration tool.
fields.summary: Poll or survey capability

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Doing certain actions on newer versions of Confluence which contains newer versions of tomcat, will results with {{400 - Bad Request Invalid character found in the request target}} error message
h3. Steps to replicate #1 - Subscribing to RSS feeds
 # On any space, go to Space Tools > Content Tools > RSS Feed
 ** Alternatively, go to <base_URL>/spaces/listrssfeeds.action?key=<space_key>
 # Click on any links: Pages, Blog, Mail, Comments, Attachments, All Content
 # Expected Results: Prompts for RSS file

h3. Steps to replicate #2 - Clicking the "Go to included page" option in Excerpt Include macro when page contains square bracket
 # Create page A which contains square brackets in the page title for example: "Page with [square] brackets"
 # Create page B.
 # Add Excerpt Include macro and point it to the page A
 # Save the Page B, Edit mode for page B
 # Click on Excerpt macro and then navigate to "Go to Included Page" button
 # Expected Results: Page A "Page with [square] brackets" will be opened

h3. Actual Results

Following error is returned in the UI:
{noformat}
HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request
Type Exception Report

Message Invalid character found in the request target. The valid characters are defined in RFC 7230 and RFC 3986

Description The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

Exception

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid character found in the request target. The valid characters are defined in RFC 7230 and RFC 3986
org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11InputBuffer.parseRequestLine(Http11InputBuffer.java:467)
org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:294)
org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:66)
org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:770)
org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1415)
org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the server logs.
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The Apache Tomcat server, which is a web server used by Confluence, is filtering out requests that contain special characters. That’s because Tomcat is using a different encoding and URI standard than most browsers.

See also Apache [Tomcat 8.5|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.5-doc/config/http.html] http docs for more details:
{quote}relaxedPathChars:

The [HTTP/1.1 specification|https://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc7230.txt] requires that certain characters are %nn encoded when used in URI paths. Unfortunately, many user agents including all the major browsers are not compliant with this specification and use these characters in unencoded form. To prevent Tomcat rejecting such requests, this attribute may be used to specify the additional characters to allow. If not specified, no additional characters will be allowed. The value may be any combination of the following characters:
{code:java}
" < > [ \ ] ^ ` { | } {code}
. Any other characters present in the value will be ignored.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Specify tomcat to allow the special characters. For the above issues, we only need to allow the comma "," character.
 # Go to <confluence_install>/conf, backup, and edit the server.xml file.
 # Find all connectors your application is using. Just search for Connector in the file, or look at the example below. You're interested only in connectors whose protocol is set to HTTP and HTTPS (not AJP).
 # Add {{relaxedQueryChars="[,]"}} to the connector properties in server.xml. For example:
{code:java}
        <Connector port="26156" connectionTimeout="20000" redirectPort="8443"
                   maxThreads="48" minSpareThreads="10"
                   enableLookups="false" acceptCount="10" debug="0" URIEncoding="UTF-8"
				   relaxedQueryChars="[,]"
                   protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"/>
{code}
#* If the above workaround does not work, try specifying the other characters by adding the following in server.xml instead:
{code:java}
relaxedPathChars="[]|"
relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"
{code}
 # Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Later version of Tomcat hit into "Invalid character found in the request target" when subscribing to RSS feeds

fields.description:
h2. Issue Description

The Atlassian Notifications plugin is used by Atlassian to send in-app notifications and messages in the format of pop-ups. In big instances (>2K concurrent users), this plugin doesn't scale properly and can be accountable for around 100K queries executed against the database in the period of an hour. 
h2. Steps to Replicate

There are no known steps to replicate, as this plugin doesn't have a logic set of steps to be triggered.
h2. Sample Queries

Queries being triggered by the plugin includes but are not necessarily limited to below examples:
h4. Expensive Join
{code:sql}
SELECT message."ID", message."CONTENT" FROM "AO_21F425_MESSAGE_AO" message JOIN "AO_21F425_MESSAGE_MAPPING_AO" message_mapping ON message."ID" = message_mapping."MESSAGE_ID"
{code}
h4. Full Table Scan
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM ( SELECT "ID", "CONTENT" FROM "AO_21F425_MESSAGE_AO" ) WHERE ROWNUM <= 1
{code}
h2. Example of Plugin Usage

The plugin is used to send messages in-app like the ones below:
 !image.png|thumbnail!
h2. Diagnose Steps & Workaround

It is not easy to spot problems caused by this plugin unless you have a good way of creating reports from your database, like [Oracle AWR Reports|https://oracle-base.com/articles/10g/automatic-workload-repository-10g]. Usually, you will see spikes in Database Connections and probably Long Running Threads. If that's a symptom you have along with slowness in the application, look into your query execution history for the queries above. If you find them, you are them affected by this bug.

The workaround by now is to disable the plugin through a Dark Feature. To do so:
 # Access <Confluence-Base-URL>/admin/darkfeatures.action
 # Add the following Dark Feature to your list:
{code:java}
whisper.disabled
{code}
fields.summary: Whisper Plugin performs several Full Table Scans/Joins in the Database

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# Issue only happens on Confluence 6.9.3, and not on Confluence 6.12.2.
# When a users edits a page, and uses a macro, the macro will be translated to the language that the user sets in their Profile.
# But if we were to change the user's language in the profile to another language, the macro is not translated to the newly updated language, until the page is edited and saved.
# If another user were to edit the page as well, the macro will be translated to the language of the user who last edited the page.

h4. Steps to replicate
# Change the language of the user in their profile page to German for example.
# Create a page and add a macro.
# The macro will be in German.
# Now change the language of the user in their Profile to another language, like English.
# Edit the page from before, and the macro will still be in German.
# If another user were to open the same page, on another machine, even if their language for their profile is set to English, the macro will still be in German, unless they were to save the page and edit it again.

h4 Current behavior
# Macro translated to the language of the user who last edited the page.

h4. Expected behavior
# Macro should display in the language of the user set in their profile.
fields.summary: Macro translated to the language of the user who last edited the page

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Team Calendar does not display 13:00 (24hours time) when profile language set to English(US)
Tested with Team Calendar 6.0.25 + Confluence 6.12.2

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
#   Navigate to https://<instance name>/wiki/admin/calendar/globalsettings.action
#  Set the time format to 13:00 24hours
#  Set profile language to English(US) from https://<instance name>/wiki/users/viewmysettings.action
#   Create a event in team calendar
#   Hover over the event and the time format display as 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Expected Results*

The time format should display as 13:00

h3. *Actual Results*

When hovering over the event, time display as 12:00 hour format


h3. *Workaround*

Set to English(UK)
fields.summary: Time Calendar does not reflect the time to 13:00 when profile language set to English (US)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Despite the notify watchers option being checked, the version history comment is not required, causing such notifications to be confusing to the recipients as to what were the changes

h3. Suggested Solution

If notify watchers is checked when saving changes on a page, version history comment should be required for easier use and understanding of other users viewing/watching it
fields.summary: Make version history comment mandatory if notify watchers is checked

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no simple or straightforward way for users to view or find out who is the current admin of the space, or who has what permission, except to contact some of the Confluence admins to help them check this out.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make Space Permissions viewable by all users, so they can check that information themselves
fields.summary: Make space permissions viewable by all users

fields.description:
Similar to CONFCLOUD-52148, however it needs to be fixed in Server as well.

 
h2. Symptoms

When attempting to restore a site XML backup to Confluence, it fails with the following error in {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{noformat}
2014-01-20 19:59:33,583 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter] importEntities Cannot import the entities: 
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/setup-restore-start.action | url: /setup/setup-restore-local.action | userName: admin | action: setup-restore-local
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import because the data does not match the constraints in the Confluence schema. Cause: SQLException: Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'unq_lwr_username'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.user_mapping'. The duplicate key value is (user1).
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.DefaultXmlImporter.doImport(DefaultXmlImporter.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEntities(BackupImporter.java:387)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter.importEverything(BackupImporter.java:355)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.FileBackupImporter.importEverything(FileBackupImporter.java:119)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(BackupImporter.java:193)
{noformat}
The XML backup contains a duplicate record that the import is trying to insert into the user_mapping table for uniq_lwr_username = user1 (for the example above).
h2. Workaround

See the KB article:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-site-xml-import-fails-with-duplicate-key-error-438993638.html]
fields.summary: Importing from Cloud site to Server fails with error related to duplicated users

fields.description:
A massive number of executions of trivial Team Calendars database queries (~94k per hour), these queries are shown below. 

 
||ID||Number of executions||Query||
|bxjvujt8jky01|35,801|SELECT "LAST_MODIFIED", "ID", "DESCRIPTION", "USING_CUSTOM_EVENT_TYPE_ID", "STORE_KEY", "CREATED", "SUBSCRIPTION_ID", "SPACE_KEY", "NAME", "CREATOR", "TIME_ZONE_ID", "COLOUR", "PARENT_ID" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" WHERE "ID" = :1|
|8ks5b97gwy741|94,606| SELECT "NAME" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" WHERE "ID" = :1|
|dw8ddwwn0ybns|94,606| SELECT "PARENT_ID" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" WHERE "ID" = :1|
|9nrktrtmzzw1v|94,605| SELECT "SUBSCRIPTION_ID" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" WHERE "ID" = :1|
|b55fvjnh7naf3|94,604 | SELECT "USING_CUSTOM_EVENT_TYPE_ID" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" WHERE "ID" = :1|
|4v0zrftdn7h32|94,603 | SELECT "STORE_KEY" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" WHERE "ID" = :1|
|6tsar6qtqrsjy|94,603 | select "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES"."ID" from "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES" "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES" where "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES"."ID" in (select min("AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES"."ID") from "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES" "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES" where "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES"."EVENT_ID" = :1 group by "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES"."EVENT_ID", "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES"."INVITEE_ID") and "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES"."EVENT_ID" = :2|
|fk68qh14pu2ur|94,602| SELECT "TIME_ZONE_ID" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" WHERE "ID" = :1|
|8sdkgurz66vz7|82,097| SELECT * FROM ( SELECT "ID", "CONTENT" FROM "AO_21F425_MESSAGE_AO" ) WHERE ROWNUM <= 1|
|b66t57uh2c2s7|60,502| SELECT "INVITEE_ID", "ID" FROM "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES" WHERE "ID" IN (:1 )|

 

 

These queries are coming from {{VEventMapper#toVEvent}} because {{eventEntity.subCalendar}} is lazy loaded.

Instead of retrieving each of the subcalendar attributes separately (which each have a database query), we can do one database query and then retrieve each of the values from it. This will result in having only a single database query instead of six, which will improve performance.
fields.summary: Team Calendars performs several unnecessary database queries due to lazy loading

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Email Notification on page edit did not display images properly

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.11.2


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Confluence with an SMTP Mail Server
#* In this testing, [Gmail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-do-i-configure-confluence-to-use-gmail-as-the-mail-server-42795030.html] is being used as a mail server
# Create a new page with an image attachment in it
# _Watch_ the page with UserA
# _Edit_ the page with UserB, changing the attached image to a different image

h3. Expected Results
Image is displayed properly in the email notification

h3. Actual Results

 !email notification.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h5. Suggestion Summary:

When creating a new page from a Global Template, the title (name) of the template is not carried over as the title of the new page, only the content of the template is loaded.
It would be great to have an option to bring the Global Template’s name as the title of the page created from it.

h5. Steps to Replicate:

# Create a new _Global Template_ with the name "Testing Title" and saved it:
 !01 template.png|thumbnail! 
 !02 template.png|thumbnail! 
# Choose to create a new page using the newly created Global Template:
 !03 template.png|thumbnail! 
# The new page will have a blank title:
 !04 template.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to carrying Global Template's page title to child page title

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding an email address to a Team Calendar event via CalDAV that does not belong to a Confluence user will not reflect in that event. This is because TC does not currently support external users.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.12.1
 * Team Calendar 6.0.25
 * OSX Calendar app.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create calendar in Confluence
 # Create UserA with email address UserA@UserA
 # In OSX Calendar app add CalDAV as explained in [subscribe to Team Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-team-calendars-from-apple-calendar-686857285.html]
 # Create an event from OSX Calendar app.
 # Add UserA and UserB to invite attendees.

h3. Expected Results

In Team Calendar new event can be observed, and both users are visible in the list.
h3. Actual Results

Only UserA is visible in the event
fields.summary: Adding non Confluence user to a calendar event from external client will not reflect in Team calendars event.

fields.description:
Bug report
h3. Summary

When a Confluence user has German set as a profile language, notifications in the Workbox part are shown as *Undefined* 

 !123.jpeg|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment

Confluence is set up with a working notifications are allowed by Confluence.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the Confluence user profile language to German
 # Add comments or mentions to the users watched contents/page
 # Subsequent notifications in the Confluence workbox will be missing the username/pagename it is instead shown as *Undefined*

h3. Expected Results

User name/Pagename is shown correctly. When the language in the user profile is English, all is as expected and user names are shown.
h3. Actual Results

*Undefined*  instead of usermentions/pagename
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: When profile language is in German workbox notifications are undefined

fields.description:
If you use the Confluence editor to create a page and bold text, it inserts the <strong> tag. However, if you use the mobile app ,it inserts the <b> tag. This is inconsistent to what Confluence does. The mobile app should use the <strong> tag as well.

This causes CONFSERVER-57472.
fields.summary: Confluence Server mobile app uses <b> for bold instead of <strong>

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In-app notifications, mentions comments,  from Jira, do not work in Confluence 6.12.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.12.1/6.12.2
Jira 7.6/7.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create application link (OAuth or Impersonization)
# Create User A and User B in both instances.
# Create user mention of user A with user B in Jira
# Check Confluence Administration > In-app notifications

h3. Expected Results
# In Confluence in Workbox notifications, you will see the notification.
# In Confluence Administration > In-app notification, you will see application link to Jira.

h3. Actual Results
# No notification is displayed.
# In Confluence Administration > In-app notification, you will *not* see application link to Jira.
 
h3. Notes
Mentions from Confluence to Confluence works.

h3.Workaround
The Bug does not affect Confluence 6.13, so the upgrade will fix the issue.
fields.summary: In-app notifications from Jira do not work with Confluence 6.12

fields.description:
Using the keyboard shortcut (E key), sends the editor window back to the top of the page instead of leaving the cursor where the user was located previously.

h3. How to replicate 
# Create a page
# Publish It
# Scroll down to the bottom of the page
# Enter edit mode by using the keyboard shortcut (E key)

h3. Expected result
- the editor cursor is placed where (approximately) the user was looking into

h3. Actual Results
- The cursor is placed at the top of the page

This behaviour is present in newer, supported, browsers such as:

- Google Chrome 70.x

fields.description:
Hello.

We updated version from 5.8.8 to 6.8.2.

We are noticed that in old version we could expand the sidebar to any width within the screen. In the new version, this has become impossible, there is a maximum width for the space sidebar.



Our users are asking to help them solve this problem, because the long full names of their pages don't displayed in spaces sidebar.



Can we expect this problem to be solved in the next versions? For example, adding a horizontal scroll bar or not limitted resizing for sidebar would solve the problem.



Best regards,
Zhanna
fields.summary: Confluence 6.8.2 has maximum width for the space sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a calendar is exported from Cloud and them imported into the server Version of Confluence, it will throw an error and not import some/ all events.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud + Team calendars
 * Confluence server 6.12.2 + Team calendars 6.0.22

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * On Cloud
 ## Create a new calendar
 ## Add event
 ## select *Add new event type*
 ## Give it a name, select icon, set a reminder and save the event type
 ## Add a new event and select the event type just created, name it, set a user in the "who" field and add
 ## Add another event with event type "events" and repeat it for a couple of days (set an end date)
 ## Export the calendar
 * On server
 ## Import the calendar (ICS file)

h3. Expected Results

The calendar should be imported without problems
h3. Actual Results

The error below is shown, some of the events are imported but some aren't.
{code:java}
Error(s) occurred.

• There was an error while importing the uploaded calendar: java.lang.NullPointerException{code}
h3. Notes

It works fine when importing on another cloud instance.
h3. Workaround

Import the calendar to a different cloud instance, export it again there and it will work to import on server.
fields.summary: Some events are not being imported on Calendars

fields.description: I when I try to add the Tableau report using the HTML Macro, confluence tells me that the site is not one of the allowed sources
fields.summary: Configuring the Whitelist in confluence for Tableau

fields.description:
h3.Steps 

 # Install Confluence 6.8.0 or 6.9.0 or 6.12.0 on Windows 10 with UAC enabled
 # Double click on the 6.13.0 installer
 # Install fails to move forwards trying to upgrade files in C:\Program Files\Atlassian

 *What happened...* 

See image below.

 *What should have happened...*

The installer should have elevated the privileges in Upgrade Mode and be able to overwrite files in C:\Program files.

As a test, I installed Confluence 6.8.0 using Windows installer and I can upgrade again using the same installer to 6.8.0 without any privilege issue.

It sounds like the Windows Installer is still not elevating Prvileges *in upgrade mode* or something?
(We know in normal install mode is okay because it can write to C:\program files\atlassian)
fields.summary: Windows installer cannot upgrade files in C:\Program Files\Atlassian

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Tomcat <9.0.13 is affected to the bug where SecureNioChannel fails with "IllegalArgumentException: You can only read using the application read buffer provided by the handler."

This is a Tomcat bug as per [http://tomcat.10.x6.nabble.com/Bug-62791-New-SecureNioChannel-fails-with-quot-IllegalArgumentException-You-can-only-read-using-the--td5078457.html]

The following log appears in tomcat.log:
{code:java}
27-Oct-2018 11:27:46.492 SEVERE [https-jsse-nio-8446-exec-32] org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process Error reading request, ignored
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: You can only read using the application read buffer provided by the handler.
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SecureNioChannel.read(SecureNioChannel.java:571)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$NioSocketWrapper.fillReadBuffer(NioEndpoint.java:1204)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$NioSocketWrapper.read(NioEndpoint.java:1140)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFrameServer.onDataAvailable(WsFrameServer.java:72)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFrameServer.doOnDataAvailable(WsFrameServer.java:171)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFrameServer.notifyDataAvailable(WsFrameServer.java:151)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsHttpUpgradeHandler.upgradeDispatch(WsHttpUpgradeHandler.java:148)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.upgrade.UpgradeProcessorInternal.dispatch(UpgradeProcessorInternal.java:54)
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProcessorLight.process(AbstractProcessorLight.java:53)
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$ConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:770)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1415)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}
h3. Symptoms
 * Increased heap usage after GC processing and GC activity potentially leading to performance issues.

 
 * If a heap dump is taken, an analysis will show two leak suspects like the following occupying most of the heap:

{code:java}
13,548 instances of "org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsSession", loaded by "java.net.URLClassLoader @ 0x5c09f4598" occupy 2,160,380,648 (51.26%) bytes.

Keywords
java.net.URLClassLoader @ 0x5c09f4598
org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsSession
{code}
and
{code:java}
6,774 instances of "org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsFrameClient", loaded by "java.net.URLClassLoader @ 0x5c09f4598" occupy 894,276,384 (21.22%) bytes. These instances are referenced from one instance of "java.util.HashMap$Node[]", loaded by "<system class loader>"

Keywords
org.apache.tomcat.websocket.WsFrameClient
java.net.URLClassLoader @ 0x5c09f4598
java.util.HashMap$Node[]
{code}
h3. Workaround
 * Use Http11Nio2Protocol instead of Http11NioProtocol within the appropriate connector of the server.xml file
fields.summary: Update Confluence Server to use Tomcat 9.0.13 to address Tomcat SecureNioChannel Bug

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It was observed when Confluence is configured to link with other applications via Application Link, such as JIRA, if that application becomes unresponsive, Confluence can also gradually become unresponsive as well (Confluence is returning HTTP 503 errors when accessed from the Load Balancer). 
 (i) The issue continues to occur even after Confluence restart.

In addition, the following stuck threads detections messages are also being thrown in the {{catalina.out}} log:
{code:java}
WARNING [ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Standalone]]] org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.notifyStuckThreadDetected Thread "http-nio-8090-exec-147" (id=5169) has been active for 63,774 milliseconds (since 11/6/18 7:42 PM) to serve the same request for https://example.atlassian.com/rest/mywork/latest/status/notification/count?_=1541562126288 and may be stuck (configured threshold for this StuckThreadDetectionValve is 60 seconds). There is/are 185 thread(s) in total that are monitored by this Valve and may be stuck.
 java.lang.Throwable
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:171)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.readFully(InputRecord.java:465)
	at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.read(InputRecord.java:503)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:983)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.performInitialHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1385)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1413)
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1397)
	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.createLayeredSocket(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:394)
{code}
Looking at the thread dumps taken during the incident window, a vast number of long-running HTTP threads are shown and most of them are stuck waiting on SSL connection. 
In specific, these {{RUNNABLE}} threads are for Confluence's [Workbox Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Workbox+Notifications]:
{code:java|title=Thread counts per status}
$ grep -A1 '-exec-' conf_threads.* | grep State | sort | uniq -c
200 conf_threads.1541570464.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
10 conf_threads.1541570464.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
200 conf_threads.1541570479.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
10 conf_threads.1541570479.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
200 conf_threads.1541570490.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
10 conf_threads.1541570490.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
200 conf_threads.1541570501.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
10 conf_threads.1541570501.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
200 conf_threads.1541570512.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
10 conf_threads.1541570512.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
200 conf_threads.1541570523.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
10 conf_threads.1541570523.txt- java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
{code}
{code:java|title=Example RUNNABLE threads}
http-nio-8090-exec-200 - priority:5 - threadId:0x00007f6f9e2e6800 - nativeId:0x355e - state:RUNNABLE
stackTrace:
java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
     at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
     at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(SocketInputStream.java:116)
     at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:171)
     at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:141)
     at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.readFully(InputRecord.java:465)
     at sun.security.ssl.InputRecord.read(InputRecord.java:503)
     at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:983)
     - locked <0x00000004f564e008> (a java.lang.Object)
     at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.performInitialHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1385)
     - locked <0x00000004f564e018> (a java.lang.Object)
     at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1413)
     at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1397)
     ...
     at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.executeAndReturn(HttpClientRequest.java:103)
     at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest.executeAndReturn(JerseyRequest.java:131)
     at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.ApplicationLinkRequestAdaptor.execute(ApplicationLinkRequestAdaptor.java:58)
     at com.atlassian.applinks.oauth.auth.OAuthRequest.execute(OAuthRequest.java:58)
     at com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.AppLinkHelper.execute(AppLinkHelper.java:64)
     at com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.AppLinkHelper.execute(AppLinkHelper.java:42)
     at com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.ClientServiceImpl.verifyAuth(ClientServiceImpl.java:171)
     at com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.ClientServiceImpl.verifyAuth(ClientServiceImpl.java:136)
     ...
     at com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.LocalNotificationServiceImpl.loadCount(LocalNotificationServiceImpl.java:385)
   	 at com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.LocalNotificationServiceImpl.lambda$_getCount$2(LocalNotificationServiceImpl.java:375)
	 at com.atlassian.mywork.host.service.LocalNotificationServiceImpl$$Lambda$1096/27140524.get(Unknown Source)
	 ...
     - locked <0x0000000438ab9e90> (a org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioChannel)
{code}
The issue occurs as each request coming from the Confluence's Workbox notifications is waiting to connect to the linked application (e.g. Jira). This then results in Confluence not having enough threads free in order to service users, leading to performance degradation.
h3. Workaround

Effort should be made to address the linked application's unavailability problem as that is what's triggering this bug. 
We may do so by performing the following diagnosis steps:
 - Please make sure that the linked application has been configured correctly in the Application Link page.
 - Please ensure that Confluence can reach all linked instances (via Application Link) over https.
 (i) Check this by using [httpclienttest|https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/httpclienttest/src].
 - If the other end (e.g. Jira) is down or no longer in service, remove the application link

(i) After resolving the issue above, you'll need to restart Confluence for the threads to be released and available to users again.
fields.summary: Confluence Unresponsive due to stuck Workbox Notifications threads

Date and time is displayed differently between page comments, inline comments, and comments against an attachment preview. 
Especially preview comments don't respect timezone in user profile.


h3. Environment

I've confirmed in Linux but it could be same in Windows as well.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set OS timezone to UTC0   
{code}
$cat localtime
TZif2UTCTZif2�UTC
UTC0
{code}
# Start Confluence
# Set different timezone for the user
!Screen Shot 2018-11-22 at 12.18.17.png|thumbnail! 
# Add a comment on page.
# Add an inline comment.
# Add a comment against an attachment preview.

h3. Expected Results

The date and time is displayed in the user's timezone for all type of comments.


h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After deleting a user, it's observed that mentions contained in comments in the #all-updates view still exist with the original user name intact and there is an additional comment created that contains a key instead of the anonymised username: 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Comment on a page and mention a user
# Delete that user
# Comment in Dashboard > All updates view contains user name and duplicate comment

 !comment_mentions.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Context
This bug only appears when the content in #all-updates belongs to the user being deleted. All-updates relies on change documents in lucene. As part of reindexing content with user mentions, we also reindex change documents, which involves first looking up the original change document for a given content object, deleting it, and then adding a new change document for the same content object. Unfortunately, looking up the original change document relies on the *username*. By the time, we try and look up the original change document, the user has already been renamed, so we don't find the original, but we do add a new one, resulting in duplication.

See {{com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.AddChangeDocumentIndexTask#perform}}

h3. Workaround
Perform a site reindex to remove the duplicates. Or, create more than 40 new changes, which will push the duplicate entry out of the all-updates tab.
fields.summary: duplicate item in dashboard all-updates after deleting a user

fields.description:
Mentions in inline tasks are ignored and not indexed in lucene as mentions. This is a change made in CONFDEV-8546 , which fixes a bug where the assignee of a task is being sent two emails (one for the mention, one for the task assignment). The fix for the bug CONFDEV-8546 made the first mention in the inline task an assignee, and ignored the other mentions in the task (i.e., not indexed). Therefore, searches for a user's mention will not return any pages where the mention exists as an assignee or as a secondary mention in the task.

GDPR removal of a user's mentions in the search index does not pick up those secondary mentions due to the above reason, and therefore the search results will continue to display the username in the excerpt.

*Workaround*:
Edit the page with the secondary mention in tasks, which will force a reindex of the page, and fix the issue.
fields.summary: Users mentioned in inline tasks who aren't the assignee (i.e. the first mention) aren't indexed as a mention

Hi,

Confluence is able to create clean URL for all the pages that contain ASCII titles.

Most of the languages uses special chars, that means that "isSafeTitleForUrl" function in GeneralUtil works for english principaly.

You should separate Title and URL in the "Page" structure.

URL could be automatically generated with a stripAccents function to allow to have clean URL when accents are used :

org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils.stripAccents(title);

WIth this feature, other languages that uses non ASCII chars could use clean URL on confluence.

Regards,

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Space sidebar contains a _Create page_ link even when the _current user_ doesn't have the _Add page_ permission.
If that user clicks on that link, then a _No Permission_ page is loaded with the wrong warning message.
Even if a mail server is configured, this page won't load the _Request Access_ button.


h3. Environment
Fresh install of Confluence *6.12.0*.
It was confirmed on *6.6.3* as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a fresh install of Confluence Server and do the following as the _admin_:
# Add a new user (_user001_) to Confluence and make sure it is added only to the _confluence-users_ group.
# Create a new space named _Space A_.
 #* Add the _View_ Space Permission and *remove* any other related to the _confluence-users_ group.

Access Confluence as _user001_:
# Access _Space A_ home page and you will see the _Create page_ link in the side bar.
# Click on the _Create page_ link and the _No Permission_ page is loaded with the wrong warning message.

h3. Expected Results
# If the user doesn't have the _Add page_ permission, the _Create page_ link doesn't appear in the sidebar.
# If the link must be there, then the _No permission_ page should give a meaningful message saying the user doesn't have permission to create pages on that Space and should render the _Request Access_ button if the mail server is enabled.

h3. Actual Results
# The user has access to a _Create page_ link even when the _Add page_ permission is not granted.
 !new_img_001.png|thumbnail! 
# Access the _createpage.action_ link to a Space on which the user doesn't have the _Add page_ permission shows a confusing message.
 #* If the mail server is enabled, there's no _Request Access_ button.
 !create_page_img001.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
_None at this moment_
fields.summary: The Space sidebar contains a Create Page link even for users without the Add Page permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In code, deciding if the _Create_ button should be rendered in the header bar (a.k.a. top bar) is an expensive operation due to permissions validation.

When the user access one of the following dashboards, Confluence uses an expensive operation to decide whether or not the _Create_ button should be rendered in the header bar:
 * All updates ({{<Confluence Base URL>/#all-updates}}).
 * Popular ({{<Confluence Base URL>/#popular}}).
 * Recently worked on ({{<Confluence Base URL>/#recently-worked}}).
 * Recently visited ({{<Confluence Base URL>/#recently-viewed}}).
 * Saved for later ({{<Confluence Base URL>/#starred}}).

The above mentioned _Create_ button is highlighted in the image below, from the user perspective:
 !create_button_dashboard_img001.png|thumbnail! 

On the background, Confluence will check if the current user has permission to create a page or a blog post on any Space.
These are assigned by _Add page_ and _Add blog_ [Space Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/space-permissions-overview-139521.html].
If more than one Space is retrieved from the above operation, then Confluence will use only one of them as a reference, which is sorted by the _Space Name_ and the _Space Key_.
No previous usage of the selected space is taken into account, meaning that it won't check for Spaces users visited before or created/edited content.


h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence could render the _Create_ button on any dashboard page, whether the user has create page permission to any Space or not.
The permission validation should be made after the user has clicked on the button.
If the user doesn't have enough permissions to create a page in any Space, then a graceful message should be displayed.

h3. Performance Impact on Scale
Looking at a single operation, the permission validation may appear as a _simple_ task.
However, when we think of an enterprise deployment of Confluence, with thousands of users accessing Confluence on a single day, then deciding when rendering the _Create_ button becomes an expensive operation.

On an enterprise instance, Confluence would look through over 250k rows in the database to retrieve a single one to complete this permission validation.

h3. Workaround
_None at this moment_
fields.summary: Rendering of create button in Confluence header bar is very slow due to permissions checks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

AD groups inherited through a user directory connection such as the "Everyone" group will have all users as members. It is desired to block a group such as this from being used to share content with, i.e. the group does not show up as a sharing recipient and therefore cannot be used to spam all users. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Create the ability to blacklist groups which will suppress their ability to be used for sharing purposes, but will leave them available for user security/permissions purposes. The could also be done via group attribute that is either "can be used in sharing" = on or off
h3. Workaround

An LDAP filter can be put in place to prevent the Everyone group from being inherent through the user directory connection, but this takes away the groups usefulness as a security/permissions group in Confluence.
fields.summary: Limit which groups users can share content with

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Allow Content Report Table Macro to be able to exclude space in result

Currently, the [Content Report Table Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-report-table-macro-317194676.html] is able specific one or multiple spaces to display the matching results, but not able to *exclude* a space.

In order to exclude a space, a tedious workaround wound be to include _every other spaces_ into the filter list except for one that is intended to exclude. 
However, if the Confluence contains a large amount of spaces, to specifically exclude spaces from the result may hit into the bug that is described in CONFSERVER-33174 which is a search query that is too long.

It would be good if the macro can configured to exclude specific space(s)

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the Space filter similar to [Recently Updated Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/recently-updated-macro-139519.html] which is able to exclude content from a specific space using the minus sign
fields.summary: Allow Content Report Table Macro to be able to exclude space in result

h3. Summary
One of the improvements announced in the R[elease Notes of Confluence 6.10.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-10-release-notes-952058221.html#Confluence6.10ReleaseNotes-Searchimprovementsforeveryone] is Improved Search for everyone, which includes
{quote}
Accents and special characters will now be ignored in search results. For example, searching "Senegal" will also return "Sénégal".
{quote}

While the feature works well when the index language is set to English, Brazilian Portuguese and French, it does not work when the index language is set to German. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set your index language to German
# Create two pages. One page with a title Senegal and the other with Sénégal.
# Type Senegal in the search field. 

h3. Expected Results
Both pages will be returned. 

h3. Actual Results
Only the page with Senegal will be returned.

Email is received as expected, but below exception is thrown in the atlassian.confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2018-11-14 16:39:50,867 ERROR [AtlassianEvent::CustomizableThreadFactory-1] [atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventDispatcher] run There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.mywork.event.notification.PushNotificationEvent@7ee35055] from the invoker [com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceListenerHandlersConfiguration$TimingListenerHandler$1$1@279aaf3e]

It appears that Mobile App Plug-in push module is invoked whenever a page is shared to an email address, so the following function is called
{code:java|title=PushNotificationDaoImpl.java}
    public List<PushNotificationAO> findByUserNames(@Nonnull Set<String> userNames, boolean isActive) {
        String whereClause = "USER_NAME IN (" + buildQuestionPlaceholder(userNames) + ") AND ACTIVE = ?" ;
        List<Object> params = new ArrayList<>(userNames);
        params.add(isActive);

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

In older versions of Confluence (tested on 6.0.1), when we click on *Edit* in a page, the editor loads in the same position the page was when it was being viewed.
 In newer versions (tested on 6.11 and 6.12.2). the editor loads from the top of the page, instead of wherever the vertical scroll was when viewing the page.

Issue persist on latest version of Chrome, IE, and Firefox.
h5. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a new page in Confluence, and add [a large amount of text|https://loremipsum.io/generator/?n=100&t=p].
 # Save the page.
 # Scroll down, to the middle or to the bottom of the page, and scroll up a little to get the *Edit* option, or use the *e* shortcut to nring up the editor.
 # Notice that the editor will load the page from the top.
 # In Confluence 6.0.1, the editor will load from where the page was last.

h5. Expected behavior
 # Editor should load in the same positon of the page when it was being viewed.

h5. Current behavior
 # Editor loads from the top of the page, even if the page was lower before *Edit* was clicked.
fields.summary: Editor scrolls back to the top when editing instead of maintaining scroll position from when viewing page

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.10, and 6.2, new languages were added to Confluence. However, indexing support for those languages were not added and so instances generating content in those languages would not be able to index and search them properly. We should add support for indexing these languages:
 * Danish
 * Spanish
 * Italian
 * Hungarian
 * Dutch
 * Norwegian
 * Romanian
 * Finish
 * Swedish

If I have time remaining I'm going to look at strategies to support multiple languages in the same instance.

Note: Icelandic, Slovenian and Estonian are out of scope as there are no official analyzers from the Lucene project.
Polish is out of scope because parts of the Stempel analyzer from Lucene uses a non-standard BSD based license which our legal team is still evaluating.
h2. Workaround

Change the "Indexing Language" of the site to "Other" in "General configuration" administration settings. This setting should work reasonably well, but not perfectly, for most languages.
fields.summary: Add missing indexing languages to Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence Mobile App(*iOS) does not work with network redirection. The APP will try to connect directly to the address added so in case a user inserts the hostname expecting to be redirected(HTTP 302), the APP will say that the version of Confluence isn't compatible.

For instance:

* A proxy in front of Confluence redirecting from https://hostname.example.com to https://hostname.example.com/confluence(Base URL).

The mobile view will redirect the URL properly, but the iOS app will try to connect directly to https://hostname.example.com, while the correct Base URL uses a context path at the end(/confluence).

h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the iOS mobile app to work with redirections, like regular browsers, or update our documentation saying that in case it exists a network redirection, use directly Confluence's Base URL.
fields.summary: Allow network redirection in iOS mobile app

fields.description:
Confluence 6.12.0
Team Calendar 6.0.20

Issue seems to be related to the issues below.
 # CONFSERVER-55165
 # CONFSERVER-55287
 # CONFSERVER-55654

h4. Summary
When a weekly repeated event is created in Team Calendar, editing a single event affects nearby events as well, in some cases moving the event to the previous day, or if an event is moved to the next day, the event that's on the next day gets shifted as well.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a repeated event like the example below.
 ** !1_create_event.PNG|thumbnail!
 # The event should be look like something below.
 ** !2_event_created.PNG|thumbnail!
 # Now if we were to edit one of the event, by extending it like below.
 ** !3_event_Extended.PNG|thumbnail!
 # Refreshing the page will show that the event from the next day is moved to the edited day.
 ** !4_next_day_event_moved.PNG|thumbnail!
 # If we were to instead move the event to the next day like below
 ** !5_event_moved_to_next_day.PNG|thumbnail!
 # Refreshing the page will cause the event to move like this.
 ** !6_event_moved_down.PNG|thumbnail!
 # There can be more variations of this issue if we were to move the events around more for example, once the events are as they are in Step 6 above, moving the event from the second day back up and refreshing the page will bring the event back down to how it was in the screenshot again, unless we were to move the event from the next day over, and move the event from the second day to the first day instead, and only then can it be returned to how it was in the beginning, like the screenshot in Step 2. 

h4. Error in the logs
{code:java}
2018-11-26 21:57:05,218 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date null time 8:00 AM
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/confluence/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /confluence/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: 87a321af2fbb072d | userName: root
2018-11-26 21:57:23,096 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-5] [extra.calendar3.util.TimeZoneUtil] tryParseDateTimeStringForEventEdit Unable to parse date null time 8:00 AM
{code}


h4. Expected behavior
# Be able to edit individual events that were created as part of a reoccurring event, without affecting events from other days.

h4. Actual behavior
# Editing individual events that were created as part of a reoccurring event, affects neighboring events.
fields.summary: Editing repeated Team Calendar events causes events next to the day to be affected

h3. Summary
In Confluence AMI deploy script for AWS we can locate file {{atlassian-aws-deployment/ami/scripts/init.d/atl-functions}}, inside file on lines 223 and 224, we are assigning incorectly string instead of variable to defaultPort and defaultConnectorPort variable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open {{atlassian-aws-deployment/ami/scripts/init.d/atl-functions}} script
# Inspect lines 223 and 224.

h3. Expected Results
Observe the code like this:
{code}
    if [[ -n "${ATL_TOMCAT_DEFAULTCONNECTORPORT}" ]]; then local defaultConnectorPort=${ATL_TOMCAT_DEFAULTCONNECTORPORT}; else local defaultConnectorPort=${DEFAULT_CONNECTOR_PORT}; fi
    if [[ -n "${ATL_TOMCAT_REDIRECTPORT}" ]]; then local redirectPort=${ATL_TOMCAT_REDIRECTPORT}; else local redirectPort=${REDIRECT_CONNECTOR_PORT}; fi
{code}

h3. Actual Results
{code}
    if [[ -n "${ATL_TOMCAT_DEFAULTCONNECTORPORT}" ]]; then local defaultConnectorPort=${ATL_TOMCAT_DEFAULTCONNECTORPORT}; else local defaultConnectorPort=DEFAULT_CONNECTOR_PORT; fi
    if [[ -n "${ATL_TOMCAT_REDIRECTPORT}" ]]; then local redirectPort=${ATL_TOMCAT_REDIRECTPORT}; else local redirectPort=REDIRECT_CONNECTOR_PORT; fi
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence AMI deploy script atl-functions incorrect assigning of variable.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement
Image caching is crucial for reducing load times to improving overall user experience. However, JPG caching is not functioning well with JPG images on certain browsers i.e. IE, Edge and Firefox. Looking closer into the header attributes, we see that the ETag attribute is not being added to the resource during reload. Hence, the JPG images have to be requested to the server on every page reload.

h2. Expected Behavior
All image files should be cached and retrieved from the cache resource instead of having to requesting from the server directly every page reload.

h2. Actual Behavior
JPG files are requested from the server on every page reload.
fields.summary: JPG Image Caching Not Working for IE, Edge and Firefox - ETag is missing from resource

fields.description:
The Page Properties Report currently supports only the following:
|*Including text***|Include items that contain this text.|CONTAINS (single word or phrase)|

** You can add these filters in CQL-powered macros but in search they're part of the standard search filters, so they don't appear in the *Add a filter* menu.

Ideally you would want to apply CQL to the text to exclude certain words and not just include.
|*Including text*|Include or exclude items that contain this text.|CONTAINS (single word or phrase), NOT(single word or phrase), OR(single word or phrase)|
fields.summary: Page Properties Report needs CQL operator support for Including Text

When a new software project space is created in Confluence, an empty Jira Servers drop-down menu appears when Confluence is connected to just one Jira server.

Usually, when Confluence is connected to more than one Jira servers, this drop down menu to select Jira server appears and we can select the desired Jira server. This is the right behaviour. 


h3. *Testing Environment*

* Confluence v6.10.2
* Jira v7.11.1

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a single application link between Confluence and Jira.
# Restart Confluence.
# Select *Spaces* > *Create Space* > *Software project space*

 !space1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Actual Result*

The following pop-up appears, with empty Jira Server drop-down menu.
 !space2.png|thumbnail!

Its only repeatable by restarting Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In our [Database Setup for SQL Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-sql-server-9258.html] documentation, step 2 item 5 is a bit unclear:

Give this user full create, read and write permissions for the database tables. Confluence must be able to create its own schema. Refer to the SQL Server documentation for how to do this. 

For many users this is done by adding the user to the *db_owner* role.

A lot of users may not be aware of this, and thus will run into permissions issues. I've personally seen this in many support tickets and on Community.

h3. Suggested Solution
Clarify in the documentation that in many cases it can be accomplished by adding the user to the *db_owner* role
fields.summary: Clarify database setup for SQL Server permissions documentation

fields.description:
Currently, when setting up new Confluence database, the application doesn't warn user when trying to connect existing, non-Confluence, non-empty database. 

This way, Confluence will connect to already used database and create tables within that new database schema (and possibly overwrite some existing tables if those are named the same).

It would be useful if Confluence would warn user that it's trying to connect to existing, non-Confluence database.

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement
Any 4 and above large photos (>0.5MB) that are being uploaded or drag&drop will be rotated randomly

h4. Steps to reproduce (Need to be tried few times as it happens randomly)
# Create a new page
# Drag & drop more than 4 photos at a time
# Publish the page

h4. Expected Result
The photos are expected to be uploaded as per original rotation from the source.

h4. Actual Result
The photos are rotating randomly.

h4. Findings
From the HAR file analysis, it is found that the photos that are being rotated have the following additional header:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Workaround
* Remove the individual photo and add it back
* Upload 3 photos or below at a time
fields.summary: Uploaded photos are rotated randomly

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The EXTRNLNKS table is responsible for tracking external pages which link to inbound Confluence pages (Referrers). This feature is enabled by default and is documented in https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/trackback-and-external-referrers-147487.html

However, this table grows unbounded, and the only time rows are removed is when the associated Confluence page has been deleted/purged. This can be especially problematic in larger Confluence environments over time, causing a large database footprint. In one observed environment, this table contained 25 million rows.

It would be good to be able to set a limit on this table whether by number of records or by date. The table contains "lastmoddate" column; perhaps this can be used to set a limit on retaining only records within a certain timeframe.
fields.summary: Options to clean up EXTRNLNKS table

fields.description:
h3. Description
When importing a space with pages that contain JIRA issue, Confluence will not trigger the Rest API to create the mentioned link in JIRA.  Example: Space X with Key X should have Key Y. Space X has a page with a linked jira issue JIRA-1. The issue itself has a link with "mentioned in" and links to confluence page in space X.
When user export Space X and rename it and it's key to Y, now the space Y also has a page with the same linked Jira issue JIRA-1. But the jira issue "mentioned in" still links to space X.  There is no link created to space Y.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a JIRA ticket name {{Bug-1}} in JIRA.
# Create a new space name {{ABC}} in Confluence
# Create a new page name {{Page 1}} in space {{ABC}}
# Add the {{Bug-1}} JIRA ticket to {{Page 1}}
(i) You will see that Page 1 contains JIRA link beside the page title. In {{Bug-1}}, we can see a {{mentioned in Page 1}} link is created.
# Export the Space {{ABC}}
# Rename the Space {{ABC}} to {{XYZ}} according to [How to copy or rename a space in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-copy-or-rename-a-space-in-confluence-169578.html] documentation
# Import the Space after changed the spacekey to {{XYZ}}
# We can see that the {{Page 1}} in Space {{XYZ}} contians JIRA issue link {{Bug-1}} but there is no {{mentioned in}} link to Space {{XYZ}} create in the {{Bug-1}} ticket

*Expected behavior*
A new {{mentioned in}} link is created in JIRA ticket

*Actual Result*
No {{mentioned in}} link is created in the JIRA ticket after imported the space that contains the link to the JIRA.
fields.summary: Import space with pages that contains JIRA issue does not auto trigger Rest API to create the mentioned link in JIRA.

fields.description:
h1. Background

Duplicates in confancestors appear if collaborative editing is enabled, and dark feature editor.ajax.save.disable is enabled as well.
h1. How to reproduce
 # Enable collaborative editing
 # Enable editor.ajax.save.disable dark-feature
 # Create a new page and save it
 # Check that duplicates appeared in confancestor table

h1.  Technical details

When editor.ajax.save.disable is enabled and user saves a page, docreatepage.action is called. Method AbstractCreatePageAction.doAdd calls assignParentPage(draft, getParentPage()) method which adds a child, and adds ancestors to the child.

But the child already had ancestors before, so assignParentPage adds duplicates.

The method "assignParentPage" is not called if collaborative editing is disabled.

To check if the dark-feature is enabled, go to <CONFLUENCE_URL>/admin/darkfeatures.action
fields.summary: Duplicates in confancestors table appear if editor.ajax.save.disable dark feature is enabled

fields.description:
I found this suggestion, but it was closed after only 2 months this year.  I would have voted for it.  Please leave open for longer to see if there is more interest.  I have seen some items open for several years.  Great Product, Thanks

When changing to edit mode the side bar gets hidden. From my experience this is counterproductive:
 * If I want to change at a specific position of a larger page, I lose track of that position while change from view to edit mode – because of the changed width (with/without the side bar) the paragraphs become reformated. At least the text position last shown in the view will be scrolled to automatically in edit mode. But due to the heavy reordering in the paragraphs it's hard to relocate the position which shall be changed…
 * Sometimes while editing I need to look back in some other pages, which's links normally would be shown in the side bar. If the side bar is missing, I have to open a new Confluence tab, go there to the page I am editing, to have the same side bar content, and only then I am able to click the relevant link. If it was still there while editing, a click with the middle mouse button had opened it directly in a new tab. 

So, please provide an option to keep side bars enabled even while edit mode is active.
fields.summary: Don't Close Sidebar while in edit mode

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
# Login into Confluence in Firefox browser.
# Edit a page (CTRL/CMD+E).
# In the editor, search (CTRL/CMD+F) for any string/word for example "and" and press Enter.
# Confluence correctly finds the first matching occurrence and highlights it.
# Clicks on "Next" to search for next matching occurrence.

*Expected Behaviour*
Confluence will highlights the next matching occurrence.

*Actual Behaviour*
Confluence stays as is and subsequent occurrences of the search term are not found.

*Workaround*
Use different browser (Chrome/Internet Explorer) or the browser's "Find in This Page..." menu option.

*Notes*
This feature was working before the update of Firefox version 63.0
fields.summary: Find Next in Confluence Editor is not working in Firefox browser

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary Confluence by default uses {{}} to wrap around bold words in a page. However, if the content of a page uses {{}} instead, users can't add inline comments on those words. This affects pages that are created *using the Confluence Mobile App* because it uses the {{}} tag. h4. Steps to replicate # Download the Confluence Mobile App (reproduced using *v0.1.40* on Android and *v1.1.0.110* on iOS). # Connect it to Confluence. # Create a page on the mobile app and add some bold text to the page. # On a web browser, try to add an inline comment on the bolded text. (i) It can also be reproduced if you directly add the problematic storage format to the database in the {{bodycontent}} table. h4. Expected results The inline comment should be successfully created. h4. Actual results The inline comment can't be created due to the error below. {quote}We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text. {quote} !image.png|thumbnail! h4. Workaround Edit the page on the web browser without making any changes and save it. Confluence will automatically switch the {{}} tags to {{}}. {code:java|title=Before} Stay strong!
{code} {code:java|title=After}

Stay strong!

{code}
fields.summary: Inline comments can't be added on words that use <b> bold tags

There's no workaround at this time
